website_summaries.verdict: Large container of cacao powder that's perfect for a busy kitchen setting.
pros: Offered at a price per ounce that's below average
Mixes perfectly into nearly any recipe
Cacao beans sourced from small farms that are certified organic
Delivers a high burst of energy and antioxidants
cons: Doesn't always deliver consistency of product from order to order

customer_reviews.title: Watch your teeth
customer_reviews.text: I eat cacao nibs a lot and have quite a few different brands. A lot of cocoa nibs have a lot of shells. This brand has far fewer shells than most. HOWEVER, I did find a rock in the nibs. Fortunately, I have learned to eat nibs carefully because of shells so no harm was done. Other than the rock, these were meh. They were less bitter than some brands but also less chocolate flavor. Kind of dusty tasting.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: but it can contaminate with high metal like mercury, arsenic
customer_reviews.text: Cacao Powder is healthy, but it can contaminate with high metal like mercury, arsenic, lead, etc which can be a major health issue, instead of good for your health. I requested the company to see 3rd party testing for metal contamination, but they refuse to release it to consumers. They claims it privacy reason.
customer_reviews.author: DaveL

customer_reviews.title: Delightful cocoa nibs. Natures candy.
customer_reviews.text: These taste really great. I used to be a chef and I worked next to the pastry chef which is where I first had cocoa nib. Finally many years later I purchased this bag. So fat the best thing I do with them is to add them to a cup of coffee. I just drop them in as they are. if gives a wonderful nutty texture with a great chocolate flavor. I like these because they contain no sugar, and it tastes great. I eat low carb, and they have a net carb count of 1 per ounce after you deduct the fiber. I will be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Baconbandit1973

customer_reviews.title: I didn't have enough research to buy this product so ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have enough research to buy this product so I think it's partially my fault! I read a review that prompted me to examine the plastic yet heavy duty container & noticed that the Cocoa EXPIRED --7 months ago. I took the time to review but I'm writing another (obviously!) before reading reason why it wasn't posted. I'm hopeful that I don't have to go through too much aggravation to return or replace this cocoa!!! Thanking you in advance for your anticipated prompt attention to this issue.
customer_reviews.author: GOODLOOKIN1

customer_reviews.title: High quality. No bits of shell.
customer_reviews.text: This brand of Cacao Nibs has no bits of shell in it, which annoys me about every other brand I've tried - so thank you, and five stars.
customer_reviews.author: A. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Terrible flavor
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried many different brands of cacao powder and this was the worst. Lacked depth and flavor and had an off tase. Definitely would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Developed the sour smell that others posted about, but still taste great.
customer_reviews.text: One bag of this size will last me probably far longer than I should keep it, but I've not had any issues with them going bad or tasting off. I was a little concerned with this new bag as I'd read some other reviews that suggested maybe the quality had gone down. My initial response was that these are just as great as my previous purchases of this brand. They looked, smelled, and tasted great. However, after a few weeks I have noticed the sour smell that others mentioned. It doesn't seem to affect the flavor and I don't notice it once it's on whatever I'm eating (just as I'm pulling it out of the bag). Very strange.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Best quality and taste organic cacao on the market exclamation
customer_reviews.text: as a chocolate maker, I can say was at Reserve that this is hands-down the best one on the market. Rich smooth taste and fine powder. I did a side-by-side taste test with two other top organic ones, which were bitter acrid or burnt taste in comparison. HealthWorks one hands down!
customer_reviews.author: Tana

customer_reviews.title: everyone was happy with the final results so I went ahead and ...
customer_reviews.text: We've been buying the Navitas brand for years, and we needed something for a very large project (think 20,000 mini cupcakes). I decided to try this, and it worked very well. The tasters noted that this was a bit more bitter than the Navitas brand, and someone else said we could use "a little more chocolate" in our recipe if we wanted, as if it didn't deliver the same kick. Overall, everyone was happy with the final results so I went ahead and purchased the 80 ounce bags for the project.
customer_reviews.author: The Allergy Chef

customer_reviews.title: Yummy chocolate goodness!
customer_reviews.text: If you still buy powdered chocolate or cacoa from the big-name brands, stop! You have no idea what is really in it or where it comes from. This is 100% raw, organic and vegan product; not the same as the chocolate and cocoa versions that are readily available. Taste the difference immediately, store in dry, cool place, tightly sealed; it will oxidize quickly if exposed to air and moisture. Buy quantity you expect to use within a short time (2-3 months), there is no preservatives or additives that will extend shelf-life like non-raw versions give you. Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys chocolate and cares where it comes from (Peru in this case).
customer_reviews.author: Debra E Brady

customer_reviews.title: All good.
customer_reviews.text: Reviews for other cacao nibs report "stones" in the package. Yikes. This is my second order from Healthworks and I've never found anything inedible. Very happy with this product/company.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: These are such a tasty way to get a nice chocolate crunch without all the baggage of sugar
customer_reviews.text: These are such a tasty way to get a nice chocolate crunch without all the baggage of sugar. I like adding them to almond butter with some protein powder and rolling them up for a tasty and quick breakfast. My daughter uses them in muffins. The only use I didn't prefer was in smoothies- I have recipes that call for them, but they just sink to the bottom. These came fresh, and we're happy to continue ordering from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Jacky

customer_reviews.title: Best cocoa, damaged package
customer_reviews.text: I love this cocoa, but today it arrived with a small puncture in the side creating a fine cloud of cocoa when I pulled it from the mailing envelope I had carefully cut the mailing envelope across the top to prevent cutting into the cocoa package so I was a little shocked. It was surprising considering the density of the packaging. It must have been accidentally nicked by something before it was put in the mailing envelope. There was a tiny bit inside the bottom, but there were no obvious cuts on the outside of the thick mailing envelope. If at wasn't bad enough, it poofed out cocoa on my laptop sitting 2 feet away and on my cast. 😣
customer_reviews.author: Susie's

customer_reviews.title: I've been purchasing this brand of Cacao Nibs pretty regular about once every 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I've been purchasing this brand of Cacao Nibs pretty regular about once every 6 weeks, and I usually like it, BUT this last bag I purchased was a disappointment. I don't know if you guys change your processor plant or what, but Ive been getting rocks and small pieces of branches with the cacao, it is soooooo annoying and dangerous. I'm about to bite down while eating and I find myself spitting out rocks and branches, very bad. I hate it. So now that I'm running out of Cacao Nibs I'm considering purchasing from another brand as I'm scared of breaking my teeth with this brand, not worth the risk. Sorry, maybe I'll try you guys again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea V.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought 4 bag. Great quality and taste. Fast shipping. I’ve bought other cacao nibs and they had so much powder in the bag. This company has good pieces. Very happy with this product and seller. I use them on Oatmeal, Chia and Flax Pudding, Yogurt, icecream, also a quick snack of whip cream with sliced strawberries and the nibs. Mmmmm so good. I also add them to different granola and nut bars I bake. Good in protein balls. My husband grinds some up with his coffee beans, he enjoys it very much. About to order bag #5.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Bad smell and taste.
customer_reviews.text: I’d give this zero stars if it were possible. I’m so disappointed because I LOVE cacao nibs! This stuff tastes awful, and has a distinct chemical smell. It tastes like common tree bark — not like lightly processed organic cocao. I should have listened to some of the other ratings.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Chase

customer_reviews.title: Pretty basic cacao powder.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with this cacao powder. It smells more chocolatey than other brands I have used. It is the same very-fine powdery consistently as other brands, adding the need to be careful when blending so it doesn't *poof* all over. It appears to mix in evenly, not leaving any clumps behind. I've used it twice so far, so I'll see how it works out.
customer_reviews.author: cathriene101

customer_reviews.title: They are delicious I really like them however today I boiled some plantain
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I have tried cacao nibs but I'm sure I will find many uses. They are delicious I really like them however today I boiled some plantain, mashed it and added coconut mana then sprinkled it with these nibs and bit into a very hard piece of what seemed to be shell, happened to my son also. Don't know if this is sometimes normal with cacao nibs with this being my first experience with them. Otherwise I would have given it 5 stars. I also grind a small amount and add it to my espresso-wow its like starbucks at home! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chewy... meh.
customer_reviews.text: Something changed. It doesn't taste as great as it used to. The texture seemed chewy rather than the expected sun-dried-crisp crunch. Either the quality of the cacao changed (different source?) or the fermenting process changed. I noticed the term "raw" is nowhere to be found on the bag and there's a label over the 'distributed by' address. Hmm.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: ~If you found this review helpful, please mark it as 'helpful'~ I add cacao nibs into all of my smoothies, so I was excited to find such a large bag for such a reasonable price. They taste great and are nice and crunchy, just how I like them. They make a great addition to any smoothie or dessert and I found their shelf life to be very long, which is nice when you buy products in bulk. Overall, I would recommend this product and would definitely purchase it again. ~For more reviews and/or product testing, please contact @madski21 on instagram~
customer_reviews.author: Madison Evans

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for rocks !
customer_reviews.text: I have been please with this brand for some time but in recent 2 orders there has contained several rocks. Most smaller pieces but also a penny sized piece. Quality control seems completely absent. My suggestion is that you do like me and switch to another brand before you bite a tooth of.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: Very good price given the quality. Aside from possible uses in baking or cooking, this makes a perfect dark hot-chocolate drink when mixed into boiling water. And it's a great taste-of-chocolate addition to coffee. Healthy and delicious! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Contains a Silver Metal (Cadmium)
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this item. The bag has a label that says USDA Organic. When I received the item I went to Consumer Labs where supplements are tested and found out that this item was tested and the test reveal that it contains 24.9 mcg of cadmium per serving. Cadmium is a silver metal. Why would an organic product contain a silver metal?
customer_reviews.author: Dottie Randazzo

customer_reviews.title: Fresh tasting
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 5 different brands of cacao nibs and decided this one tastes the best. Most recently, I've purchased Viva brand, which is fine, but this one has a richer cacao flavor and is actually less dusty. I have not found any rocks in them, but I would not be surprised if I did and most brands have a few shells here and there. A lot of natural foods will contain natural elements. Organic greens often have live beetles & bugs living in them even after I take them home, quite the adventure...
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I've been drinking this for a couple of years, now only once or twice a week to err on the side of caution of the cadmium argument. The company does note their test results in the Q&A section. Thank you for that. I add it to chocolate almond milk with a dollop of black-strap molasses to satisfy any sugar cravings and give myself an extra boost in the iron, potassium, and magnesium department (among other nutrients).
customer_reviews.author: M.L.

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good product
customer_reviews.text: This Cacao powder MIGHT have health benefits, but it certainly can't hurt. i add it to my first cup of coffee getting started and just hope it does something...it at least adds a chocolaty flavor that is nice. We certainly already know that 90% of anything you take in as helpful additives do NADA.
customer_reviews.author: James Rawie

customer_reviews.title: Bag was punctured : (
customer_reviews.text: So far, this is my favorite cocoa. I drink it like others drink their coffee. It does settle..so I've found that if I use a blender to blend it with my favorite nut milks first (chocolate cashew milk)-creating a condensed cocoa- I can keep that in the fridge and pour some in a cup then add boiling water then add more nut milk if you wish.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Something's wrong!
customer_reviews.text: I buy a lot of cacao nibs. It's like an addiction for me. I've bought this brand before without any issues but this time they tasted like chemicals mixed with coffee grounds. I tried to use them but ended up replacing them with another brand that taste as they should. I won't buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: NCMartha

customer_reviews.title: They made improvements. I would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product several months ago and didn’t like it because it had some lumps in it. I tried it again and the consistency is much better. The taste is excellent. I would highly recommend it. I’m going to purchase it again. It works great in smoothies or stirred into some almond milk.
customer_reviews.author: drsteve

customer_reviews.title: High levels of cadmium
customer_reviews.text: I was dismayed to see that testing by consumerlab.com listed this cocoa powder as containing next to the highest levels of cadmium in their test. I had no problem with the taste but I must stop buying this product for that reason
customer_reviews.author: coolbreeze

customer_reviews.title: Love this cacao powder!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cacao powder. Used it in a number of recipes...favorite is with coconut cream to make a frozen desert. What's not to love!!!! Have gifted to others.
customer_reviews.author: gbutter

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cocoa powder, put on our steel cut oats breakfast, as well as, granola cereal. Also use it exclusively in baked goods.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: This is really good quality cacao
customer_reviews.text: This is really good quality cacao. I like health works in all their products. It’s delicious and I use it for everything from my smoothies to making chocolate mousse. There is a nice energy boost to when you use it. I also use it for my kids hot cocoa during the wintertime knowing that they’re not getting food dye, read 40 to be exact, which is a ridiculous ingredient to have in hot cocoa being as it’s already brown in color. It is also well priced for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I like the flavor and consistency of the powder, but, call me crazy, I really prefer to get a product that doesn't expire a week after receiving it. The nutritional value of cacao or any supplement is in its freshness, so I don't have a lot of confidence in this product.
customer_reviews.author: medire27

customer_reviews.title: healthy treats for kids of all ages
customer_reviews.text: the kids (and the adults) love the healthy chocolate smoothies we make with this stuff. huge bag lasts for months in the fridge. how we roll- 3 heaping tbsp cacao 8oz? soy milk 1 frozen banana 8 ice cubes pinch of vanilla, chili powder, ginger, etc. to taste maple syrup to taste Vitamix from low to high until smooth. add just enough soymilk to keep the blades turning
customer_reviews.author: mark s

customer_reviews.title: Yes, I agree with another review - It's Gone Terribly Wrong
customer_reviews.text: The package looks similar (not 100% the same as on Amazon). But in Amazon I had looked at the calories in one of the images and it was 19 but in the thing I recieved the calories is 130. So many companies are getting bad. Don't buy from them.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jackson

customer_reviews.title: So Satisfying
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy an expensive mocha product every month because I just loved that pure chocolate flavor. Since I started using this cacao powder I no longer need to buy that mocha because I am getting the same satisfaction out of drinking this. Plus it lasts longer than one month. And after researching all the health benefits in pure cacao I am a customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: Andrina

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Cacao!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good brand of Cacao. We use it to make a delicious fudgy treat we call "balls". Take 1 container of raisins, 1 container of prunes and 1/2 to 3/4 cup of this cacao powder and blend together in a food processor. Then roll into balls and to keep from sticking together, roll in more cacao or in unsweetened coconut. Store in an airtight container in the fridge between pieces of parchment. A healthy sweet snack we make all of the time. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Kytka Hilmar-Jezek

customer_reviews.title: Warning: contains stones and debris!
customer_reviews.text: A bit of debris, shells, and rocks in this brand. My first handful from the bag had a pea sized stone in it! Thank goodness I didn't bite down or this would be a different review! The nibs are aromatic and taste good as expected, but the amount of shell debris is disappointing. The Viva Labs brand I was buying previously is much higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: masonsjax

customer_reviews.title: Dark Bitter Organic Chocolate Powder- AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: Update: This cacao is still just as good since the first day I gotten it. Seems to be just as fresh, thanks to the zip lock on top! I've had it for alittle over a year now. Definitely recommend! I LOVE this cacao! Very strong in flavour, and bitterly sweet. Has a wonderful dark chocolate taste. This powder is very finely ground, can be very versatile. Comes in a huge bag that will last me forever! Definitely worth the price! I use this cacao for a lot of stuff already, and probably more stuff in the future. I've already used it for baking (brownies are to die for!), and I put it in my coffee (tastes so good!)
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Autumn

customer_reviews.title: This product has LEAD and CADMIUM in it!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize this when I bought it, but this product has LEAD and CADMIUM in it! Super dangerous. Do not purchase!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jayden Riley

customer_reviews.title: powerful flavor
customer_reviews.text: i have chocolate every day in a smoothie, and sometimes in ice cream. this stuff is great. this is by far the best value i've found on the internet at the time of writing ($31 for 4 pounds).
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: I have some every morning.
customer_reviews.text: I have a tablespoon of this in my coffee every morning and LOVE it. Maybe it gives me lots of vitamins and minerals but for sure it tastes wonderful! I buy it about once ever couple of months, I think, and it is well worth the cost. The taste difference between this and coco powder is striking This is much smoother and less bitter. I will never switch back!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Foster

customer_reviews.title: Best Clean Mood Booster
customer_reviews.text: No joke! I have been in the funk and have zero agency but needed to stop drinking coffee because of the caffeine! Tried this and am like a busy bee but no caffeine issues! I can drink this before bed and nonissue! Unheard of for me with even decaf coffee! Also, I am in such a better mood and I am up during the day and even evenings doing what I have to do as opposed to being depressed! I love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Fauzia Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Flavor
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the flavor of this product! I have tried others, but this one is the best. Does not mix in cold substances well, in hot, like coffee or oatmeal, it's fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Beaupre

customer_reviews.title: and this is by far my favorite. I love chocolate
customer_reviews.text: I have now purchased several products from Healthworks, and this is by far my favorite. I love chocolate, but hate the added sugar you get in most chocolate bars. Even bars advertised as 75% cacao have added sugars. However, adding this to my smoothies, the fruit provides natural sugars that compliment the cacao powder which is a good source of both protein and iron in addition to being a source of several phytonutrients. Unlike some other super foods in which there is little or no evidence for the benefits, there is actually some solid scientific evidence supporting the health benefits of cacao. As a bonus, I find it satisfies my craving for chocolate.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Taylor Bevins

customer_reviews.title: Delicious in smoothies, hot cocoa, and as a baking ingredient...
customer_reviews.text: A quality product, at a good price, I will buy this again. Used this in baking, in smoothies, and also as a hot cocoa (with hot water, stevia, and food grade cinnamon oil). Really good product, and I think the 2 pound bag is an even better value than the 1 pound bag (which I've also bought on Amazon:). Today I baked with this and a single cup made my gluten-free, paleo, vegetarian brownies super chocolatey! Happy eating~*
customer_reviews.author: Visionary

customer_reviews.title: Worth the try
customer_reviews.text: Add this Superfood to your smoothie and it will change your life. It just taste like chocolate and the bitterness disappears. No after taste or bad flavor. It is just chocolate when you mix it with smoothie, my wife has tried it with coffee and she was so pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Robot

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: If you really want to taste one of the best Cacao, you have to try this one. the taste is perfect. The smell is wonderful. this is one of the best products i ever tried.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Just wish there was better packaging available
customer_reviews.text: Just wish there was better packaging available. The "zip lock" doesn't like to close because of the cinnamon getting into the groove so it's really not resealable and trying to compress any extra air out causes the powder to recontaminate the zip lock if I do manage to get it cleaned out.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Unadulterated, Authentic.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the price and quality of this Cacao powder. One thing to know is that it is extremely fine powder so it takes some effort to get it to mix into liquids. My first attempt at mixing it into coffee was comical. It ended up making a pasty, lumpy mess. But I adapted quickly and now I shake it in a jar first to get it to mix thoroughly. It is so delicious. There are no additives or anti-caking agents, just finely ground cacao that is very flavorful.
customer_reviews.author: PF

customer_reviews.title: What happened?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I really liked the two pounds in the 2 separate bags. Now the 2-lbs is in one big bag and boy is it lumpy. I usually put a tablespoon in my coffee - now it's difficult because all I get is big lumps. Please go back to the two separate one-pound bags.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen M.

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Cocoa!
customer_reviews.text: This is a staple in my family. I had a subscription to the 1 lb. size which is no longer available, so I was happy to see that there is a subscription offer for the 2 lb bag because now I can share some with members of my family. Before this recent order, I had tried out another brand on the strength of the reviews; but when it came and I sampled them side by side, there was no comparison. Henceforth I'll stick with Healthworks.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very healthy but very bitter.
customer_reviews.text: This is very healthy for you but too bitter for me. My plan was to use these in smoothies but if I have to put a ton of sugar in or honey, agave etc to neutralize the bitterness then to me there is no point. However this is extremely healthy so I will still recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Aja

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally flavorfull!
customer_reviews.text: MMMMMMM This cacao is so dark and richly flavored. It's certified organic raw cccao powder-- a superfood. It's a great source of vitamins, minerals and is one of the richest natural food sources of antioxidant flavones. See chocolate really is good for you! It has a slightly bitter taste, like dark chocolate, but that's overcome by whatever you mix it in. I've added it to pudding, cocoa, smoothies and used in baking.
customer_reviews.author: ricracTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Cocao
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent quality cocao powder. I have been purchasing this for years and have it on auto delivery so I don't run out. I have read that the difference between raw "cacao" as opposed to "cocoa" powder is that cacao beans are cold pressed and then milled which will protect their flavor and nutrients while cocoa is made from the same type of bean but by using high heat temperatures. Try a little in your coffee - you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this several times and it was great. The recent delivery tastes awful and there is no option to return the product. It's either rancid, burnt or both but either way I'm out $20. Without quality control or a return option it's a gamble to purchase these cacao nibs. I hate to leave a poor review when it truly can be a great product, but unless the quality or return policy is addressed I recommend looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: This Cacao powder tastes very good. I use it in my smoothies and mix ...
customer_reviews.text: This Cacao powder tastes very good. I use it in my smoothies and mix it in with my vanilla protein powder when I want chocolate flavor. It's uses would be similar to the unsweetened chocolate powder you get at the grocery store, but this is the healthy version. I haven't baked a chocolate cake with it yet, but that's next on the list. It's a large bag and a good value for the money. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good brand I will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Tastes good but not too chocolaty indicating that it is indeed raw and not roasted or over fermented. Have not encountered any shell pieces which so many people complain about with all brands. I'll see if there are any fragments at the bottom of bag but so far so good. I'm satisfied I found the right brand and will be a repeat buyer.
customer_reviews.author: nowuknow

customer_reviews.title: Delicious treat
customer_reviews.text: This cacao powder is raw and cold pressed. It has a wonderful depth of flavor, with hints of dark fruits and some slight bitterness. Mixed into some heated cashew milk it is a yummy treat that is actually good for you. I do not use any sweetener with mine, but if your palate calls for something a bit less edgy add some cinnamon and local honey and you will have a delicious treat. This one is destined to become a staple in my household.
customer_reviews.author: C. Keibler

customer_reviews.title: Good But Questionable Expiration
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered this a few times and its quite good. On a recent order, there was no "best used by" or expiration date, so it is possible that Amazon is selling the manufacturer's overstock, at least at times. I inquired and no reply was given, instead, Amazon said the date may have been smeared off. Unlikely, since no imprint was on the bag. For this reason, one star removed. To be clear, other orders for this product had an expiration date, the only exception being theSeptember 2015 order.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Love my cacao nibs
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I love chocolate and to be able to add this wonderful raw cacao product to my smoothies is such a treat. This is always the last thing I add to my smoothie and once in awhile, I forget. One taste and I know what I'm missing. Back to the bullet we go for more blending with my nibs! Yum.
customer_reviews.author: Bollie17

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: The first order of Cacao nibs I received from Healthworks was amazing! It was definitely fresh. This second one I purchased I could not eat. It was the worst quality I have received from any seller online or in the store. Take your chances with this company.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor bad bag
customer_reviews.text: Best cacao powder I've bought yet. I have also bought thrive market's 2 lb bag and a couple other brands but this has the best flavor and is incredibly finely ground! The bag does suck so put it into a ziploc storage bag...but other than that it is amazingggg!
customer_reviews.author: Nate the Great

customer_reviews.title: great taste, great value
customer_reviews.text: The taste was very good, and the value was terrific. I stumbled on a similar quality powder at a local discount market or I would have bought it again. I think it lasted about a year! I'll probably buy it again, as cocoa powder is a given in my diet.
customer_reviews.author: oolala53

customer_reviews.title: Everything you want for decent price.
customer_reviews.text: Everything you want in an organic cocoa powder for a decent price. I purchase it regularly and have no problems. Buy a large cocoa canister from your local grocer then refill it with these bags once you've used it. I've found nothing else as good for the price. I make a morning cocoa chai every day with cocoa+stevia+ginger+cinnamon+cardamom with hot water and splash of soy milk and it's AWESOME. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren L. Swain

customer_reviews.title: Bag is brittle in cold
customer_reviews.text: Product is great and I’ve been using it in my smoothies for a long time. The bag it comes in sucks, the plastic is brittle in the cold and tends to break during shipping in the winter months. Because it’s a food product you can’t request a replacement or start a return. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: bri

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful taste!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a lot of chocolates of all kinds from all over the world... this is one of my favorites so far! I also tried with water as suggested on the package and taste very good!! Highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: debora romano

customer_reviews.title: Not the best Cacao. Rocky/stemmy/something
customer_reviews.text: Not the best Cacao. Rocky/stemmy/something. . . there's hard pieces in here. Also a bit chewier than others. Navitas is clearly better quality, of the two I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: JohnOB

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting and easy to mix.
customer_reviews.text: Great tasting - not lumpy at all. For a delicious mocha, I stir together in a mug: 1 tablespoon cocoa powder, 1/2 teaspoon of a soluble fiber (like Benefiber), and a tiny scoop of stevia, then fill the mug with hot coffee. Yum!
customer_reviews.author: A.A.Norman Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: tastes great
customer_reviews.text: I mix a spoon full on my granola for breakfast in the morning, it has a nice dark chocolate crunch to it that blends well with the other pieces in the cereal. Will be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Glendamae

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Four stars for value...you get a lot of chocolate powder for your money! And it does seem natural without adulterants, including sugar. Its probably got lots of antioxidants and bromides. HOWEVER, the taste is only average Its a relatively mild taste, more like a milk chocolate than a darker chocolate. I use it in drinks, including hot cocoa and in cooking. I prefer Valrhona, Giardelli, Lindt, etc.
customer_reviews.author: E. Miller

customer_reviews.title: I can't find one thing I don't love about it
customer_reviews.text: This cacao is ADDICTIVE! I can't find one thing I don't love about it! Also, it mixes very easily in liquid to make a great hot chocolate! I have been making hot chocolate made with this, water, and goats milk for friends routinely ... a great treat in this cold weather! Did I mention that this is a fantastic deal? Much less expensive than what I purchased in San Francisco, and better!
customer_reviews.author: Good Migrations

customer_reviews.title: Affordable chocolate for baking
customer_reviews.text: For the first time I added 1/2 cup of this cacao to 3.5 cups flour for baking bread with a chocolate kick, and it came out very nice. I think this cacao is stronger than regular coco, so you may use less than coco. It doesn't bother me that the cacao is unsweetened, because I butter my bread and also use jam, so the serving result is sweet enough, and there's something very satisfying about chocolate in any form. Importantly, this was the best price I could find for the most ounces of any kind of chocolate anywhere, so I'll buy this product regularly (unless the price goes out of my budget).
customer_reviews.author: AmazShopper

customer_reviews.title: Um um good
customer_reviews.text: Been buying this product for a long time really like it will keep buying it highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: docdave602

customer_reviews.title: Not the most select I've had.
customer_reviews.text: I found these to have an unacceptable amount of husks or shell....whatever the part of the cacao bean is that can't be chewed. I sprinkle them in my smoothies, and I'm constantly having to spit out little pieces that are tough, gritty, or sort of papery. In addition, I sometimes get a bad taste from one, a moldy taste. I have ordered brands before that did not have this many inedible pieces.
customer_reviews.author: fritterer

customer_reviews.title: ... this just to see if I could make a better hot cocoa
customer_reviews.text: I tried this just to see if I could make a better hot cocoa.. I think this product is better for adding to recipes that need a chocolate taste or color. It isn't like the instant cocoa drink mixes. Better for cooking, and pastry making.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Weldon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't smell like chocolate at all.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased cocoa nibs before and these smell nor taste nothing like the ones I first purchased. I don't remember which ones I originally purchased. I wanted to use this bag up, but I think I won't. Not at all pleased.
customer_reviews.author: SandyK

customer_reviews.title: Not gluten-free.
customer_reviews.text: I was cross contaminated with gluten while using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bit Homel

customer_reviews.title: Stinks like vinegar
customer_reviews.text: These cacao nibs smell terrible! Very strong vinegar flavor, which is unusual compared to the other brands we have tried. Some suggest that we should leave them sit out to “finish fermenting,” but after a week, they still stink. Avoid!
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: How wonderful to have a great product like this one available ...
customer_reviews.text: How wonderful to have a great product like this one available on amazon! It isn't easy for many of us to find superfoods like raw cacao in stores (yet!) so online availability is great. The product itself is first-rate, delicious, and an excellent addition to my breakfast smoothie. When you read about all the health benefits of cacao, rather than commercially produced cocoa, and find how easy it is to add those benefits to your daily diet, you'll be quickly won over.
customer_reviews.author: an avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal! Worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: Delicious and healthy. Wouldn't recommend plain unless you are a particular chocolate fan. Love to add this to oatmeal with peanut butter. Occasionally you might find a piece of husk, they are tough but just spit them out.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: After receiving this product I found that not only is the health works brand less expensive but it appears to be richer and I do
customer_reviews.text: I am actually using this product as a healthy coffee substitute. I mix this product with hot water. Sometimes I add a little rice dream or almond dream and a bit of agave. It provides me with my morning cup of bitters without the caffeine. I can also drink it through out the day. I initially purchased a different brand from our local co-op but it was 3 x's the price. After receiving this product I found that not only is the health works brand less expensive but it appears to be richer and I do like it better. I will buy this product again,
customer_reviews.author: Vidya

customer_reviews.title: This cacao powder is great - I mix it with some matcha green tea ...
customer_reviews.text: This cacao powder is great - I mix it with some matcha green tea and almond milk as my morning wake up drink and it's great. It has a bit of a bitter taste that I'm still getting used to (since it doesn't have sugar added) but I generally add a half a teaspoon of raw agave or honey and the combination of flavors is great. The cacao has a lot of antioxidants and minerals so I highly suggest others to try.
customer_reviews.author: Neysha Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Heavy metals
customer_reviews.text: After invaluable research, I have found that this product is loaded with heavy metals. No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Candi

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and tasty!
customer_reviews.text: I love putting these cacao nibs in my oatmeal in the morning. It gives a great chocolatey crunch. It also tastes great on yogurt, ice cream and cereal. I love that it’s so healthy. Definitely buying this again!
customer_reviews.author: Jen P.

customer_reviews.title: Great treat. Some sugar product is necessary
customer_reviews.text: Rich with flavor. I have used it in smoothies mostly so far. Today made some raw chocolate macaroons since we have fresh coconut meat. I added a nut on the top. Then put in freezer for an hour. Great treat. Some sugar product is necessary. I used half the honey recommended. You can also use stevia. Next time I will try without the honey. I used a dash of sea salt. I did not include vanilla powder or extract.
customer_reviews.author: lara

customer_reviews.title: this is a good buy! It has a nice rich chocolate flavor
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge bag of cacao! I need to start making some brownies or something because I've got cacao coming out my ears... lol. Having said that... this is a good buy! It has a nice rich chocolate flavor. If you compare it to a box of Hersheys Cocoa powder, this is much deeper in color and has a richer taste. It makes delicious brownies, icecream, smoothies, hot chocolate... you name it!
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: I love the taste and mixes well in shakes
customer_reviews.text: this is a great buy and i use it to flavor my vanilla meal shake and to make chocolate almond milk.
customer_reviews.author: Lias

customer_reviews.title: Cocao verses chocolate
customer_reviews.text: Amazing cocao! I have always used Baker's chocolate squares, but from now on I will use this powder. So easy and you can use a little or a lot depending on how much chocolate flavor you want. Glad I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Janet R.

customer_reviews.title: Very bitter
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to add to my morning smoothies. Flavor is very bitter compared to other brand I've used. Does not blend very well. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: cacao POW!
customer_reviews.text: this stuff is great. goes into every smoothie we make. will put it in hot chocolate to and other mixtures. we bought this mostly for the health benefits of including it in our diets and we have to say it does exactly as advertised. this is certified organic and goes well with many things. recipes with cacao can be found all over the internet. great for baking to. came shipped perfectly and we still have A LOT left as this is a big bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sanborn Family

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: At first I liked it but now I don’t. I didn’t particularly care for the powder taste when I added it to my shakes. It probably is fine for baking with. I personally won’t buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Know your product...
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to grind them in my Vitamix, oh what a mistake.It melted became 4” of chocolate mortar... yikes, impossible to clean and I wasted the entire bag... However, if “you know how to use them, more power to you!lol
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Tieman

customer_reviews.title: Too many carbs.
customer_reviews.text: Bought because of low sugar, should have looked at the total carbs.
customer_reviews.author: Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Great for Keto Bombs!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this powder for quite some time. I go through a lot of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Shakes and Smoothies
customer_reviews.text: I use this powder every morning in my smoothie and blend in my Vitamix. It's got a rich chocolate taste and I know full of great antioxidants. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: One word; YUM!!! Superfood or not ...
customer_reviews.text: One word; YUM!!! Superfood or not, this cacao powder is packed with FLAVOR! I have used it in everything from making hot cocoa to dusting some on a scoop of ice cream and everything in between, and the flavor is just so tasty as to defy description. I will absolutely buy this again soon!
customer_reviews.author: M. Mallett

customer_reviews.title: Chocolate without sugar!  WIN WIN!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the taste! I add this to my vega one chocolate shake because I wanted something much more chocolately but without sugar. Perfect. It's also great in banana smoothies! I'm so glad that I can still have chocolate (gave up sugar about a year ago).
customer_reviews.author: Oklahoma Wind

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite cacao nibs. I use them in my smoothie and on top of lots of foods like yogurt. I will be back for more!
customer_reviews.author: Chad  Braunschweiger

product_meta.title: Healthworks Cacao Powder (32 Ounces / 2 Pounds) | Cocoa Chocolate Substitute | Certified Organic | Sugar-Free, Keto, Vegan & Non-GMO | Peruvian Bean/Nut Origin | Antioxidant Superfood
product_meta.description:
Flavor:Cacao Powder| Size:2 Pound (Pack of 1)

Healthworks Organic Cacao/Cocoa Powder is grown and harvested sustainably on small Peruvian farms to come to you in its purest, most nutrient-rich state. Healthworks Cacao Powder is certified organic, pure, all-natural and vegan

Our cacao powder is a nutrient dense superfood that is grown, harvested, and pressed into fine powder. The process we use retains the cacao's authentic rich flavor and valued nutritional benefits.

One of the most nutritionally complex foods on the planet, Cacao is also a great source of magnesium, dietary fiber, calcium, zinc, iron and potassium.

Great with smoothies/drinks, cereals, yogurt, oatmeal, baked goods, cookies, ice-cream, trail mix, granola bars, coffee, snack foods, or as a fantastic chocolate chip substitute in any recipe for a tasty and fun meal! Taste great with Coconut or Almond milk!

Healthworks Cacao Powder also goes very well with Healthworks Cacao Nibs, Chia Seeds, Maca Root Powder. Coconut Oil/Flour and Goji Berries.

Ingredients: Theobroma Cacao: Food of the Gods

WARNING:This product can expose you to chemicals including lead, which is known to the State of California to cause cancer or birth defects or other reproductive harm. For more information go to: www.P65Warnings.ca.gov.
feature_bullets: PREMIUM ORGANIC CACAO POWDER: Sourced from small organic farms in Peru, Healthworks Cacao Powder is made from the morsels of hand harvested cacao bean that is carefully milled into a fine powder. it has a deep & intense chocolate flavor which is a great addition to your daily meals and desserts. Healthworks Cacao Powder is keto-friendly, vegan, non-GMO, and certified organic.

MANY BENEFITS & NUTRIENTS: A guilt-free nutrient dense Superfood that contains a rich supply of plant-based antioxidants, magnesium, calcium, zinc, iron, copper, potassium and is low in carbohydrates and sugar-free. Containing Theobromine, a powerful stimulant naturally present in raw cacao, Healthworks Cacao Organic Powder provide an all-natural jitter-free energy boost similar to caffeine in coffee!

HEALTHY ALTERNATIVE & COUNTLESS USES: Healthworks Sugar Free Cacao Powder is a perfect addition to smoothies/drinks, cereals, yogurt, oatmeal, baked goods (brownies & fudge), baking cookies, ice-cream, trail mix, granola bars, coffee, snack foods, or as a great tasting chocolate alternative free of sugar and additives. Raw, Juicing, Vegan, Paleo, Keto, Clean Eating, Wellness, Active, Biohacking, Life Hacking, Yoga, Spiritual, Blending, Non-GMO, Plant Based.

CACAO VS. COCOA: Chocolate has been around for centuries with indigenous tribes treasuring the cacao bean for its nutritional and natural properties. Confused by many, cacao and cocoa have different characteristics. Common chocolate-based foods are derived from cacao seeds which come from the cacao plant.
OUR MONEY-BACK GUARANTEE: 100% Money-Back Satisfaction Guarantee, No Questions Asked! We will offer a 30-day money back guarantee on any product you have purchased from HEALTHWORKS directly.
